shoppingActions.title: Second hand
shoppingActions.fact: The textile industry is the third largest consumer of water in the world

shoppingActions.title: Toxins
shoppingActions.text_3rdPerson: Avoid toxic cleaning products around your home
shoppingActions.text_1stPerson: I avoided toxic cleaning products at home today
shoppingActions.fact: Nitrogen, phosphorus and ammonia are 3 common ingredients found in conventional cleaners

shoppingActions.title: Organic
shoppingActions.fact: Organic cotton is grown in a way that uses methods and materials that lessen the impact on our environment while conventionally grown cotton uses more insecticides than any other crop in the world

shoppingActions.title: Recycling
shoppingActions.fact: Buying recycled products, or products made from recycled materials has many benefits - Reduces water and pollution - Conserves landfill space - Uses less energy and fewer resources

shoppingActions.title: Sunscreen
shoppingActions.text_1stPerson: I bought sunscreen without nasty chemicals
shoppingActions.fact: 1 raindrop amount of oxybenzone is enough to kill the coral reefs in an area of 6 Olympic pools.One 6 oz can of sunscreen might have 40 drops.

shoppingActions.title: Plastics
shoppingActions.text: Buy plastic - free body care products
shoppingActions.text_3rdPerson: Buy body care products without micro - bead plastics
shoppingActions.text_1stPerson: I bought body care products without micro - bead plastics
shoppingActions.fact: Plastic microbeads are in face soaps, body washes, and even toothpastes.They are sometimes included in “age - defying” makeup(yes, filling in wrinkles with plastic dust!), as well as lip gloss and nail polish.Most wastewater treatment doesn’ t filter out microbeads, and they get discharged into waterways. [1] As a result, micro - plastic particles are found in bays, gulfs and seas worldwide, as well as inland waterways.

shoppingActions.title: Clothing
shoppingActions.text_3rdPerson: Buy clothing from sustainable brands(i.e.Patagonia, prAna, Pact)
shoppingActions.fact: Nearly 70 million barrels of oil are used each year to make the world 's polyster fiber, which is now the most commonly used fiber in our clothes and it takes more than 200 years to decompose.

shoppingActions.title: Waste
shoppingActions.text_3rdPerson: Buy zero waste products(i.e.Lush care products, package free)
shoppingActions.fact: A full 32 % of the 78 million tons of plastic packaging produced annually is left to flow into our oceans; the equivalent of pouring one garbage truck of plastic into the oceanevery minute.
